Time and money are both barriers for me in this regard, thank you for your patience)
WHAT IS LIFELIKE? Pesky living appliances have taken over the rural streets of Greenbury, Ohio! The sudden outbreak occurred after Nathan Weeks—local appliance store owner known for mysterious magic experiments—was found dead on the pavement outside his business. Rumor had it, he’d been attempting to create a Lifelike… An impossible magical being in a robotic body comparable to a human. Play as Nathan’s grandchild, Leo, a tired teen who’s falsely blamed for the appliances. Trounce toasters, lamps, and other misbehaving machinery as Leo responds to a weird call for help at the condemned appliance store.

The world of LIFELIKE is a marriage of fantasy and science fiction set in the late 2000s where magic users bend electromagnetic waves to their will. Turn based magic attacks adapt real-life wave behavior into fast paced action-command style combat that relies on strategic button presses and movement. Even during enemy phases, players can defend against attacks and send them back to deal more damage.

(image one) A Lifelike. A magic made lifeform in a mechanical body, comparable to humans in both intelligence and physical capability. There is no definitive proof that creating a Lifelike is impossible, yet it has been all but written off by scholars of magic. I will prove them wrong.

Though foul play was initially suspected, his cause of death has been ruled as cardiac arrest. He is survived by his son, daughter-in-law, and one grandchild. Weeks was a proficient magic user known for experimenting on appliances in his store-
